intro: Eumachia balabacensis, commonly known as the Balabac sandpiper plant, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
